content: I hit to synchronize button on https://bors.rust-lang.org/queue/rust because a PR got lost, but it seems like this operation is more invasive than I expected -- I think this ended up cancelling the current run and also added some things to the queue that shouldn't be there (i.e. failed a previous run and were not approved again).
For example, https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93675 got queued again, but shouldn't have been.

I think this happens every time the synchronize button is hit. It's just a little buggy.

My guess: It scans the comments looking for r+ commands, but doesn't see that it already failed, and so should not be re-approved. I don't know how to make homu understand that. Perhaps it could look for "Test failed" comments? That might not always work very well, though.
ye synchronise can do that = we had to check all the prs in the queue after a sync
